athletes.name: Rocky
athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 3:49.0 → 1:54.5 split @25 → very efficient at capped rate.
250m: 49.9s → 1:39.8 split @39 → strong sprint with another gear.
2k check: 1k split ~6s faster than 2k split (8:01.5) → good aerobic efficiency.
Note: Balanced profile. Strong efficiency plus sprint capacity. Keep building aerobic base; well‑rounded for head races and regattas.
Focus: Endurance

1k @24: 3:56.6 → 1:58.3 split @26 → slightly higher rate than Rocky; efficient, but buying some speed with extra strokes.
250m: 49.8s → 1:39.6 split @46 → strong top‑end power and rating ability.
2k check: Not available. Worth retesting soon.
Note: Balanced profile. Good gears and aerobic control; next step is sustaining over 2k to confirm endurance.
Focus: Endurance
athletes.name: Aidan
Zach
athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 3:54.3 → 1:57.1 split @27 → decent speed but slightly high rate → stroke efficiency could improve.
250m: 50.0s → 1:40.0 split @44 → strong sprint.
2k check: 2k split 2:06.5 (8:26.1) → 1k split ~9s faster → efficiency gap is there, leaning toward sprint profile.
Note: Sprint‑leaning athlete. Good power; needs aerobic conditioning and rate control to close the endurance gap.
Focus: Aerobic base

1k @24: 4:22.7 → 2:11.3 split @31 → much higher than target rate → relying on rating instead of power per stroke.
250m: 1:08.5 → came off his seat → sprint not completed properly.
2k check: 2:42 split (10:48.1) → much slower than peers.
Note: Still developing. Needs technical consistency, stroke length, and confidence in test pieces before a clear profile.
Focus: Technique
athletes.name: Harry

athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 4:14.6 → 2:07.3 split @27 → slightly high on rate, moderate efficiency.
250m: 55.4s → 1:50.8 split @43 → decent top‑end power.
Note: Moderate endurance and solid sprint. Balanced potential but needs aerobic development and capped‑rate control.
Focus: Efficiency
athletes.name: Henry C

athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 4:19.7 → 2:09.8 split @26 → endurance needs work; slower split at a reasonable rate.
250m: 57.6s → 1:55.2 split @44 → sprint weaker than peers.
2k check: 2:16 split (9:07.4) → 1k only 6s faster → limited aerobic efficiency.
Note: Endurance‑leaning but lacking power. Needs both aerobic conditioning and sprint strength. Development athlete.
Focus: Power
athletes.name: Reuben

athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 4:43.8 → 2:21.9 split @26 → still building base; slowest 1k.
250m: 57.4s → 1:54.8 split @41 → surprisingly strong sprint for a new J14.
2k check: No data yet.
Note: Classic “new rower” profile — weak aerobic base, but raw power potential. Focus on technical development and aerobic conditioning.
Focus: Technique + Endurance
athletes.name: Virgil
Henry B
athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 4:07.3 → 2:03.6 split @28 → decent speed but slightly high rate.
250m: 54.1s → 1:48.2 split @45 → strong sprint.
Note: Sprint‑leaning with developing endurance. Good power but needs aerobic efficiency at controlled rate.
Focus: Aerobic base

athletes.name: Henry T
athletes.coachNote:
1k @24: 4:04.5 → 2:02.2 split @27 → strong for J14; slightly high rate but moving well.
250m: 51.3s → 1:42.6 split @44 → very strong sprint relative to peers.
2k check: 2:11 split (8:45.5) → 1k split ~9s faster → good efficiency and aerobic base for age.
Note: Balanced with strong potential. Good aerobic and strong sprint. One of the more promising younger athletes.
Focus: Balanced development
